author: PA News Agency
title: Woman believed to be held hostage in Gaza declared dead | Norwich Evening News
text: A hard-hit Israeli kibbutz has announced the death of Judih Weinstein — an American-Canadian-Israeli woman who had been thought to be held hostage in Gaza. The news came six days after Ms Weinstein’s husband, Gad Haggai, was also declared dead. Ms Weinstein, 70, and Mr Haggai, 73, were taking an early morning walk near their home in Kibbutz Nir Oz on the morning of October 7 when Hamas militants burst across the border into Israel, killing about 1,200 people and kidnapping 240 others. In the early hours of the morning, Ms Weinstein was able to call emergency services and let them know that both she and her husband had been shot and send a message to her family. Ms Weinstein and her husband had been thought to be among the hostages still held in captivity in Gaza. But six days ago, the kibbutz announced that Mr Haggai was killed on October 7 and his body was taken to Gaza. On Thursday, the kibbutz said it had learned that Ms Weinstein was also killed on October 7 and her body is also being held in Gaza. It was not immediately clear how Israeli authorities determined their deaths. The couple are survived by two sons and two daughters and seven grandchildren, the kibbutz said. US President Joe Biden said he was “devastated” to learn of Ms Weinstein’s death, especially after hearing about the couple during a meeting with their daughter. The families “have been living through hell for weeks. No family should have to endure such an ordeal”, he said in a statement. Ms Weinstein was born in New York and was an active member of Kibbutz Nir Oz, a small community near the Gaza border where she taught English to children with special needs. The kibbutz said she also taught meditation techniques to children and teenagers who suffered from anxiety as a result of rocket fire from Gaza. Mr Haggai was a retired chef and jazz musician. “Judy dedicated her life to serving others, spending years teaching English and using her passions for poetry, puppeteering, and mindfulness to empower children of all backgrounds,” her family said in a statement. In a YouTube video made during a brief round of fighting between Israel and the Islamic Jihad militant group last May, Ms Weinstein read a series of poems and expressed hope for better days ahead. “I truly hope that the next time I’m recording some Haiku it won’t be under duress, under rocket fire, under conditions where people are at war,” she said. “May we all be granted the right to our basic rights of home, food, shelter and peaceful days. Here’s hoping.” Al Haggai, one of the couple’s sons, told Israel’s Channel 13 that the family had originally hoped their mother’s multiple citizenships would allow her to be released during the week-long ceasefire in late November, when 105 hostages were let go. Almost all were women and children. He said that when his mother’s name was not on any of the daily lists, he started to suspect that something had happened to her. According to Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s office, at least 23 of the approximately 129 hostages believed to be held in Gaza have either died or been killed in captivity. Nir Oz was one of the hardest-hit Israeli communities on October 7, with roughly a quarter of its residents killed or kidnapped. The families of missing hostages have drawn widespread support and sympathy in Israel as they press the government to reach a new ceasefire deal to bring home their loved ones. Mr Netanyahu met on Thursday in Tel Aviv with some of the families, where he told them there were behind-the-scene efforts to bring the hostages home, according to a statement from his office. “I can’t elaborate on the details, we are working to return everyone,” he said.

author: Michael Bailey
title: Lunch with the AFR: Farmer billionaire Johnny Kahlbetzer is focused on saving the planet with Twynam Earth Fund
text: Meet the farmer billionaire who wants you to do nothing about climate Johnny Kahlbetzer knows humans won’t change anything just for the planet’s sake, so he’s obsessed with backing technology that’s not only greener, but better and cheaper. [Michael Bailey](/by/michael-bailey-j67s5)Rich List co-editor I joke to Johnny Kahlbetzer that I’ve booked out Beppi’s just for us. When the relaxed-looking boss of the Twynam group walks in from his office around the corner, the Darlinghurst institution – founded by the late Beppi Polese in 1956 – is otherwise devoid of diners. The fact that it’s the first Monday of the NSW school holidays is no doubt to blame. Still, if the Polese family was really going to shut the place down for anyone, it may well be for a Kahlbetzer. author: Investing.com
title: Hackers iranianos atacam campanha de Trump, levando a acusações criminais Por Investing.com
text:
Autoridades federais de aplicação da lei devem anunciar acusações criminais na sexta-feira relacionadas a um suposto ataque cibernético iraniano a e-mails de membros da campanha do candidato presidencial republicano Donald Trump. Fontes relataram as acusações planejadas hoje.
Os detalhes específicos das acusações, incluindo a natureza dos delitos e as identidades dos acusados, não foram divulgados. O anúncio fornecerá detalhes sobre a investigação e as evidências que levaram à decisão de apresentar acusações. O ataque teria como alvo o sistema de e-mail da campanha, mas a extensão da violação e as informações obtidas não foram tornadas públicas.
O momento das acusações ocorre em meio a tensões elevadas entre os Estados Unidos e o Irã, sendo a cibersegurança uma área crítica de preocupação. O incidente ressalta as vulnerabilidades contínuas na infraestrutura digital das campanhas e a crescente ameaça de atividades cibernéticas patrocinadas por estados.
O anúncio na sexta-feira lançará luz sobre os esforços das agências federais para combater a espionagem cibernética e a interferência no processo político. As autoridades têm trabalhado ativamente para salvaguardar a integridade do sistema eleitoral, especialmente na preparação para a eleição presidencial.
As autoridades de aplicação da lei não forneceram comentários sobre o relatório antes do anúncio formal. O impacto do ataque na campanha e as subsequentes ações legais ficarão mais claros uma vez que as acusações sejam oficialmente reveladas. A Reuters contribuiu para este artigo.
Essa notícia foi traduzida com a ajuda de inteligência artificial. Para mais informação, veja nossos Termos de Uso.

author: 小浪财讯
title: 人工智能ETF基金（159248）涨2.40%，半日成交额2391.01万元|人工智能_新浪财经_新浪网
text:
7月31日，截止午间收盘，人工智能ETF基金（159248）涨2.40%，报1.067元，成交额2391.01万元。人工智能ETF基金（159248）重仓股方面， 新易盛 截止午盘涨4.76%， 中际旭创 涨8.07%， 寒武纪 涨3.11%， 科大讯飞 涨2.87%， 豪威集团 跌1.48%， 海康威视 跌0.70%， 中科曙光 涨0.38%， 澜起科技 跌0.61%， 金山办公 涨5.89%， 浪潮信息 涨3.22%。
人工智能ETF基金（159248）业绩比较基准为中证人工智能主题指数收益率，管理人为万家基金管理有限公司，基金经理为贺方舟，成立（2025-07-10）以来回报为4.19%。

author: Silvia Seminati
title: Parcheggi di Città Alta, pienone e ingorghi nel giorno festivo con le temperature primaverili | Corriere.it
text:
Alluvione in Spagna, a Valencia i morti sono più di 200: «Duemila chiamate per i dispersi». Allarme meteo alle Baleari I tuoi preferiti Salva questo articolo e leggilo quando vuoi. Il servizio è dedicato agli utenti registrati.
Non hai un account? Registrati in 1 minuto Accedi Hai salvato un nuovo articolo Trovi tutti gli articoli salvati nella tua area personale nella sezione preferiti e sull'app Corriere News.
Parcheggi di Città Alta, pienone e ingorghi nel giorno festivo con le temperature primaverili di Silvia Seminati I display alla Conca d’Oro indicano che non ci sono posti disponibili, ma c’è chi supera lo stesso il varco
La pattuglia dei vigili alla rotatoria della Conca d'Oro
Il giorno festivo di ieri, con le temperature primaverili, deve aver spinto molti a scegliere di andare a pranzo o a fare una passeggiata in Città Alta. E, a un certo punto, il sistema della Ztl — con i display ad indicare i posti liberi negli unici tre parcheggi in struttura del borgo storico — è stato messo a dura prova.
Nei festivi, le telecamere della Ztl di Città Alta vengono accese dalle 10 alle 12 e dalle 14 alle 19. Vuol dire che tra mezzogiorno e le due del pomeriggio si può salire senza dover per forza parcheggiare nel giro di un quarto d’ora in uno dei tre parcheggi in struttura, perché con le telecamere spente non scattano le multe. Ma questo è un discorso che vale solo in linea teorica, perché poi — nella pratica — altri posti auto, al di fuori di quelli nei tre silos, non ce ne sono. Le strisce blu lungo le Mura, con l’apertura del parcheggio di via Fara il 4 maggio scorso, sono state colorate di giallo e riservate ai residenti. Restano solo parcheggi privati, per esempio quelli dei ristoranti (ma al di fuori della Ztl interna del borgo storico).
E ieri, da mezzogiorno in poi, il traffico verso Città Alta è via via aumentato. I parcheggi di piazza della Libertà e del San Marco, i più vicini al varco della Ztl, si sono riempiti. E ad un certo punto il display alla Conca d’Oro ha iniziato a indicare zero posti disponibili in tutti i tre parcheggi (Parking Fara, via Tre Armi e Porta Sant’Alessandro), ma molti automobilisti hanno proseguito lo stesso la corsa verso Città Alta. «Ci siamo accorti — spieg a l’assessore alla Mobilità, Marco Berlanda — che c’era una coda molto lunga all’ingresso del parcheggio di via Fara. Abbiamo pensato a un guasto alla sbarra oppure a un malfunzionamento dei display dell’infomobilità, ma dai controlli è emerso che era tutto regolare. Molte persone hanno deciso di mettersi in coda davanti agli ingressi dei parcheggi, in particolare a quello di via Fara, per provare a entrare man mano che si liberavano. Qualcun altro è tornato indietro. C’è stato un affollamento abnorme e si è deciso di inviare una pattuglia della polizia locale alla rotatoria della Conca d’Oro per la gestione del traffico».
I vigili sono rimasti lì quasi fino alle 15 per spiegare agli automobilisti che, con i tre parcheggi pieni e la Ztl attiva, si doveva fare marcia indietro. «Non c’è una procedura strutturata, si valuta giorno per giorno se e quando mandare ai varchi la polizia locale — spiega l’assessore Berlanda —. Anche domani (oggi, ndr ) terremo la situazione monitorata. Mi sento, in modo particolare, con il collega di giunta Giacomo Angeloni (che ha la delega alla Sicurezza, ndr ) e con la polizia locale, prima di decidere come intervenire».
Berlanda spiega che si sta cercando di rendere sempre più chiari i display dell’infomobilità, per evitare che la gente si fermi davanti ai pannelli per cercare di capirli. «La scritta — dice l’assessore — è stabilita dal ministero e non si può cambiare. Noi possiamo modificare i colori. E così, se la Ztl è attiva, lo scriviamo in rosso, mentre se le telecamere sono spente, la scritta è verde. Non tutti i pannelli che abbiamo sono a colori, ma man mano che vengono sostituiti, li prendiamo con questa possibilità».
Vai a tutte le notizie di Bergamo
Iscriviti alla newsletter di Corriere Bergamo

author: @bienenschoolnu
title: Alumni Spotlight: Kate Lee | Northwestern Bienen School of Music
text: Kate Lee ’17, has served as director of choirs at Maine East High School in Park Ridge, Illinois, since August of 2018. In her first year on staff, Lee increased student enrollment in the choirs from 34 to 120. Her philosophy of education is influenced by her experience as a first-generation immigrant from South Korea. In addition to her culturally responsive approach to teaching, she has established a choir that brings together special education and general education students. In recognition of her leadership and innovation in and outside of the classroom, Lee was named the Illinois State Board of Education’s 2021 Outstanding Early Career Educator of the year. What made you choose the Bienen School of Music? I wanted to attend a university where I could double major in music education and voice performance, because at the time, I was equally passionate about both! I also knew that I wanted to continue to be challenged in subjects outside of music, so I ended up minoring in sociology as well. Plus, my family lived only 40 minutes away, so I could always make a quick trip home for some home-cooked Korean food in times of desperation. Which professor influenced you most during your time at the Bienen School of Music? I sang with [Donald Nally](https://music.northwestern.edu/faculty/profile/donald-nally) in BCE (Bienen Contemporary/Early Vocal Ensemble) for four years. I also sang in his graduate conducting seminar every quarter and took his advanced choral conducting course as well. As much as I love the standard choral canon, I almost never sang it in undergrad. Dr. Nally has inspired me to push the limits of music programming in my high school choral program. We probably won't be singing Pelle Gudmundsen-Holmgreen or David Lang anytime soon, but through these experiences I understand the importance of programming repertoire that is innovative and culturally relevant to my students. Tell us about a particular experience that impacted you during your time at the Bienen School of Music? One of my first concerts with BCE was in 2014 when we sang David Lang's Little Match Girl Passion and Ted Hearne's Privilege. We had the opportunity to rehearse with and sing for the composers. It was a particularly special concert for me because my parents were in the audience. I was just blown away at the whole experience: the genius compositions, the musicianship of my peers, and the leadership of our director. It was cathartic for me to be able to share all of that with my parents, who immigrated here and sacrificed so much so that I can live a better life in America. What lessons did you learn at Bienen that have continued to resonate with you in your career? - Conducting is connected to the breath (credit to Donald Nally). - Everyone can sing (credit to the late Steven Demorest). I teach this to my students everyday. - It is not always the performer's role to elicit emotions in the listener. More often than not, it is the music's role, and we are just the vessels through which a story is told (credit to singing lots of new music in BCE). - Musicianship is not the same thing as creativity, and creativity must be taught (credit to Maud Hickey). Top three of your Desert Island Discs (any genre) Bach's Mass in B Minor Mahler's Symphony No. 2 And my students have recently introduced me to BTS and there is no going back! Video

organizations.name: northwestern bienen school of music kate lee

author: Clément Mazella
title: Eddie Jones persiste : il explique pourquoi Antoine Dupont n'est pas dans le Top 3 mondial | Actu Rugby
text:
Voir mon actu Suivre Actu Rugby Son classement avait fait beaucoup réagir. Et en avait offusqué plus d’un. Interrogé par RugbyPass , Eddie Jones avait révélé son Top 3 actuel des meilleurs joueurs du monde . Et aussi étonnant que cela puisse paraître, Antoine Dupont n’était pas dans sa liste.
Eddie Jones s’explique sur Dupont Dans son Top 3, l’Australien, désormais sélectionneur du Japon après avoir été notamment à la tête de l’Angleterre, citait les Néo-Zélandais Ardie Savea et Richie Mo’unga, ainsi que le Sud-Africain et double champion du monde Cheslin Kolbe.
« Quand on m’a demandé de faire ce classement, j’ai répondu du tac-au-tac et j’ai sorti les trois premiers joueurs qui sortent du lot dans mon esprit: Savea, Mo’unga et Kolbe », explique, auprès de nos confrères de L’Equipe , Eddie Jones. Qui souligne notamment qu’il voit plus jouer ces 3 éléments, évoluant dans le championnat japonais.
Et au sujet de l’absence d’ Antoine Dupont , Eddie Jones lâche :
Sur la saison qui vient de s'écouler, je n'estime pas que Dupont peut être numéro un. Il y a selon moi un élément qu'on ne peut pas occulter, c'est la déception de la Coupe du monde pour l'équipe de France. [...] Quand on se prête à ce genre de petits jeux, toujours très subjectifs, on se base sur le talent individuel, mais aussi sur les résultats d'une équipe, sur le contexte d'une saison. J'estime que le meilleur joueur du monde, une année de Coupe du monde, doit au moins faire partie des finalistes".
Eddie Jones Sélectionneur du Japon Il loue Dupont Dans son argumentaire, Eddie Jones mentionne toutefois la grande estime qu’il a pour Antoine Dupont, « incontestablement très doué ».
Vidéos : en ce moment sur Actu À lire aussi
Antoine Dupont meilleur joueur de l’histoire : un média dit non, et son GOAT est une surprise ! « Dupont est l’un des meilleurs joueurs au monde. Il a toute la panoplie, en attaque, en défense ; il influence son équipe et il est de ceux qui sont capables de renverser le cours d’un match sur un éclair de génie, sur une seule action ». Ouf…
Suivez toute l’actualité de vos villes et médias favoris en vous inscrivant à Mon Actu .
#Antoine Dupont
